{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3314012,"name":"Scott Bartz","username":"liteduty6758","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/e495f1/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-20T23:05:53.469Z","cooked":"

Hello, again, we’ve encountered yet another problem that we are having trouble fixing. We deploy our code, and it deploys just fine, but in DriverStation, it shows no code and gives the error of
"﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ ﻿ERROR﻿: importing /home/lvuser/py/robot.py failed! ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ Traceback (most recent call last): ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ File “/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/robotpy/main.py”, line 68, in _load_robot_class ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ spec.loader.exec_module(module) ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ File “”, line 994, in exec_module ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ File “”, line 488, in _call_with_frames_removed ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ File “/home/lvuser/py/robot.py”, line 20, in ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ from rev import CANSparkMax ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ ModuleNotFoundError: No module named ‘rev’ ﻿
" I have tried to uninstall and reinstall rev, tried removing the files that call on rev, and by copying all the code in them and that didn’t work. Is there just a problem with robotpy-rev right now?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-02-20T23:05:53.469Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":150,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":761.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":455487,"topic_slug":"rev-in-python-is-no-longer-being-recognized","display_username":"Scott Bartz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61745,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-in-python-is-no-longer-being-recognized/455487/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3314058,"name":"Scott Bartz","username":"liteduty6758","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/e495f1/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-21T00:10:22.619Z","cooked":"

Mechanical here,
We solved the problem by beating it with a hammer. Donk
In actuality our code required that we had robotpy-rev in specifically “requires = [‘robotpy-rev’]” in our pyproject.toml.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-02-21T00:10:22.619Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":23.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":455487,"topic_slug":"rev-in-python-is-no-longer-being-recognized","display_username":"Scott Bartz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61745,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-in-python-is-no-longer-being-recognized/455487/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3314089,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-21T01:17:32.889Z","cooked":"

Glad to hear that you figured it out!

You have to ensure that the rev package is installed on both the robot and on your computer… which, the way to do it (as you figured out) is by adding it to pyproject.toml.

If you can think of a way to make this more intuitive for the next person, let me know.
